SX0013/24 AIP SUPPLEMENT EDDF/FRA/FRANKFURT/MAIN VALIDITY: 21MAR24 - 30APR25 INSTALLATION OF A RIAS AT FRANKFURT MAIN AIRPORT TO INCREASE SAFETY WHEN XNG RWY 07C/25C, A RWY INCURSION ALERTING SYSTEM (RIAS) HAS BEEN INSTL ON TWYS M6 AND M30 IN ADDN TO THE EXISTING CAT II/III HLDG PSN INCLUDING STOP BAR. THIS SYSTEM IS ACT EVEN BY THE SLIGHTEST XNG OF THE ACT STOP BAR AND ALERTS THE PILOT. FST, THE ACFT APPROACHING THE CAT II/III HLDG PSN IS DETECTED BY A MICROWAVE SENSOR SYSTEM. IN CASE OF AN UNAUTHORISED XNG OF THE ACT STOP BAR, FOUR VERY BRIGHT, FLG RED SFC LGT AT THE CAT I HLDG PSN AS WELL AS TWO RED LGT EACH ON BOTH SHOULDERS OF TWY BTN THE CAT I AND CAT II/III HLDG PSN ARE ACT. THE LGT IS DIRECTED TOWARDS THE PILOT AND THUS ALERTS THE PILOT OF AN IMMINENT RWY INCURSION. IN ADDN, THE ATC TWR CONTROLLERS ARE ALERTED

SX0008/24 AIP SUPPLEMENT EDDF/FRA/FRANKFURT/MAIN VALIDITY: 01APR24 - 31JUL24 RECONSTRUCTION OF THE EASTERN TWY BRIDGES AND PARTIAL CLOSURE OF TWY P. TWY P WILL BE CLSD BTN TWYS P4 AND N11 DRG THIS PERIOD. THE JUNCTIONS LEADING TO TWYS P4, P6, P8, P10 AND P14 TO THE E WILL BE MARKED AS CLSD BY MEANS OF RED STOP BAR LGT. AFT LDG ON RWY 07L/25R, ACCESS TO THE APN WILL EXCLUSIVELY BE VIA TWY P1. IN DEV FM THE SPECIFIED TIMES OF THE WINTER SER SEASON, IT WILL NO LONGER BE POSS TO USE DEICING PADS 1 AND 2 UNDER ANY WEATHER COND FM THE TIME THE EASTERN TWY BRIDGES ARE CLSD. - OPR DIRECTION 25: ALL TAX TFC (INBD) FM RWY 25R WILL BE ROUTED VIA TWYS P1, N-N, N15 AND ONWARDS VIA TWY L TO THE E. ALL TAX TFC (OUTBOUND) WILL BE CONDUCTED ACCORDING TO THE STD. - OPR DIRECTION 07: ALL TAX TFC (INBD) FM RWY 07L WILL BE ROUTED VIA TWYS P1, N-N, N15 AND ONWARDS VIA TWY N TO THE E. TAX TFC (OUTBOUND) IN THE DIRECTION OF RWY 18 WILL BE ROUTED VIA TWY L ACCORDING TO THE STD. PILOTS WHO ARE UNA TO ACPT A TKOF RUN ON RWY 18 AFT GUIDANCE FM TWY L SHALL NOTIFY APN CTL IN GOOD TIME. IN THIS CASE, TAX TFC (OUTBOUND) IN THE DIRECTION OF RWY 18 WILL BE ROUTED VIA TWYS L, Y AND N. THE TRANSFER OF TAX TFC (OUTBOUND) IN THE DIRECTION OF RWY 18 BTN APN CTL AND THE TWR IS CONDUCTED IN FRONT OF TWY L20. ALTERNATIVELY, ACFT CAN ALSO BE ROUTED VIA TWYS L, N15 AND N. ACFT TURNING E ONTO TWY N FM TWY N15 (COMING FM THE N) DO NOT CONFLICT WITH ACFT TURNING W ONTO TWY N FM TWY N15 (COMING FM THE S). - TAX TFC (OUTBOUND) IN THE DIRECTION OF RWY 07C WILL BE ROUTED VIA TWY L. ACFT UP TO ICAO CAT MEDIUM FOR WHICH AN INT TKOF IS REQ WITH APN CTL WILL BE TRANSFERRED TO THE TWR IN GOOD TIME. PILOTS SHOULD INFORM THE TWR AS EARLY AS WITH THE START-UP APPROVAL WHETHER THEY ACPT AN INT TKOF 07C. FOR OPR DIRECTION 07, SULU DEP MIGHT BE PROACTIVELY MOV FM RWY 07C TO RWY 18. - THE IMPORTANCE OF THE PUBLISHED HIRO PROC WHICH REQUIRES VACATING THE RWY AS QUICKLY AS POSS AFT LDG, BEING READY FOR TKOF AT THE RWY WHEN DEP, AND TAX OFF IMT UPON RECEIPT OF THE TKOF CLR. IN GEN, ALL ACFT OF CATEGORIES MEDIUM AND LGT DEP FM RWY 18 SHOULD ALSO PREPARE FOR A TKOF FM TWY M OR TWY S. CONTRARY TO AD 2.20 EDDF SECTION 5.3, ALL ACFT PARKED ON ACFT STANDS E OF TWY N4 SHALL EXP TO TAX TO RWY 18 VIA TWYS U, T, R AND S. THE EXACT CLSD HR AND CLSD AREAS OF THE TWY CONCERNED WILL BE ANNOUNCED VIA NOTAM

SX0024/23 AIP SUPPLEMENT EDDK/COLOGNE/BONN VALIDITY:05OCT23-JUN24 - NEW CONSTRUCTION OF TWY B. AT KLN/BONN AIRPORT, THE ENTIRE TWY B IS BEING RENOVATED. FOR THIS PURPOSE, EIGHT CONSTRUCTION PHASES WERE DEFINED PRIOR TO THE MEASURE. THE AREA BETWEEN THRESHOLD 14R AND THRESHOLD 06 HAS ALREADY BEEN COMPLETED. THE SECTION OF CONSTRUCTION PHASE 2.3 WILL BE COMPLETED ON 04 OCT 2023 AND RE-OPENED TO FLIGHT OPERATIONS. IN THE PERIOD FROM 05 OCT 2023 JUN 2024, THE RENOVATION WORK OF CONSTRUCTION PHASE 3 WILL BE CARRIED OUT.TWY B WILL BE RESURFACED IN CONCRETE. IN UNFAVOURABLE METEOROLOGICAL CONDITIONS, THE LARGE-SCALE GROUND CONSTRUCTION WORK MAY CAUSE VISIBLE ACCUMULATIONS OF DUST. THE CLOSED TWY SECTIONS WILL BE MARKED/LIGHTED DURING THE DAY AND AT NIGHT. DURING THE ENTIRE CONSTRUCTION PERIOD, THE FOLLOWING RESTRICTIONS TO FLIGHT OPERATIONS AS WELL AS SPECIAL OPERATING PROCEDURES WILL APPLY: - CLOSURE OF THE INTERSECTION AREA TWY B AND TWY A DUE TO CONSTRUCTION PHASE BA 3. - CLOSURE OF AIRCRAFT STANDS B17, B14, B12, B11, B10, C50, C06, E09 AND E10, AND RESTRICTION FOR STAND B16 FOR THE PARKING OF AIRCRAFT (RETOWING OF AIRCRAFT IS ONLY POSSIBLE IF STAND B18 IS VACANT). -THERE WILL BE NO TAXIWAY CONNECTION BETWEEN TWY B - TWY A7 AND TWY A5 DURING THE ENTIRE CONSTRUCTION PERIOD. TWY A5 CAN BE ACCESSED VIA TWY A (UP TO CODE LETTER F) AND VIA TWY E (FOR CODE LETTER C, EXCLUDING A321, B737 MAX 10, MD-82). -THERE WILL BE A DIVERSION FOR TWY A BEYOND THE CONSTRUCTION AREA DURING THE CONSTRUCTION WORK. ESTABLISHMENT OF A PROVISIONAL TWY CENTRELINE TO BYPASS THE SECTION OF CONSTRUCTION PHASE 3 VIA AREAS NORTHEAST OF THE CONSTRUCTION SITE (REDUCED AREAS OF TWY A). THIS INTERIM TAXI GUIDANCE IS RESTRICTED TO CODE LETTER C AIRCRAFT. ADDITIONALLY, AN INTERIM HOLDING POINT IS MARKED ON THE PROVISIONAL CENTRELINE TO ALLOW AIRCRAFT TO KEEP CLEAR OF INTERSECTION A5. - GUIDANCE BY A MARSHALLER ALONG THE CONSTRUCTION SITE IS ABSOLUTELY MANDATORY FOR ARRIVALS AND DEPARTURES. - WHEN RUNWAY 14L IS IN USE, AIRCRAFT LARGER THAN CODE LETTER C WHICH ARE PARKED ON AIRCRAFT STANDS A, B, V, W, F AND E CAN ONLY TAXI ONTO RWY 14L/32R VIA TWY A5 COMING FROM TWY A BECAUSE THE TAXIWAY CONNECTION TWY A - TWY A7 IS RESTRICTED TO CODE LETTER C AIRCRAFT. - WHEN RUNWAY 14 IS IN USE, AIRCRAFT LARGER THAN CODE LETTER C WHICH ARE PARKED ON AIRCRAFT STANDS C AND D CAN ONLY TAXI ONTO RWY 14L/ 32R VIA TWY A7 COMING FROM M-CENTER BECAUSE THE TAXIWAY CONNECTION TWY A - TWY A7 IS RESTRICTED TO CODE LETTER C AIRCRAFT. - WHEN RUNWAY 32 IS IN USE, AIRCRAFT LARGER THAN CODE LETTER C WHICH ARE PARKED ON AIRCRAFT STANDS C AND D WILL HAVE TO BE GUIDED VIA TWY A7 UP TO TWY A5 ON RUNWAY 14L/32R OPPOSITE THE TAKE-OFF DIRECTION BECAUSE THE TAXIWAY CONNECTION TWY A - TWY A7 IS RESTRICTED TO CODE LETTER C AIRCRAFT. - WHEN RUNWAY 32 IS IN USE, CODE LETTER F AIRCRAFT WILL HAVE TO VACATE RWY 14L/32R VIA TWY A5 AT THE LATEST.

SX0031/24 AIP SUPPLEMENT LFMN/NICE/COTE EXPERIMENTATION OF 4 INITIAL APPROACH PROCEDURES TO FACILITATE OPTIMIZED DESCENTS. VALIDITY: 18APR24 - 25DEC24 THIS AIP SUP CONCERNS THE OPERATIONAL ASSESSMENT OF OPTIMIZED DESCENT PROFILES ON THE INITIAL APPROACHES (INA = INITIAL APPROACH PROCEDURE) OF FLIGHTS INBOUND FOR NICE COTE D AZUR (LFMN). AN OPTIMIZED DESCENT MEANS A DESCENT WITH REDUCED FUEL CONSUMPTION AND NOISE POLLUTION (TO DESCEND CONTINUOUSLY, TO THE GREATEST POSSIBLE EXTENT, BY EMPLOYING MINIMUM ENGINE THRUST, IDEALLY IN A LOW DRAG CONFIGURATION, PRIOR TO THE FINAL APPROACH POINT). THROUGHOUT THE VALIDITY PERIOD OF THIS AIP SUP, AND WHEN CONDITIONS ALLOW (TRAFFIC, WEATHER, ETC.), THE CONTROLLER USES THE PROCEDURES PUBLISHED IN ORDER TO LIMIT RADAR VECTORING. THE CREWS, WITH THE INFORMATION OF THE DISTANCE REMAINING TO THE RUNWAY MUST PERFORM OPTIMIZED DESCENTS AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE THE OPERATIONAL ASSESSMENT WILL TAKE PLACE AT ANY TIME (DAY OR NIGHT), DURING LIGHT TRAFFIC SITUATION, ONCE THE AIRCRAFT HAS BEEN TRANSFERRED TO NICE APP. IF THE TRAFFIC SITUATION DOES NOT ALLOW THE USE OF THE TRAJECTORIES,THE PILOT SHOULD EXPECT RADAR VECTORING TOWARDS THE INITIAL FIX OF THE PROCEDURE IN USE. RNAV(GNSS) PROCEDURES: RWY04R RAPOT1M/1N RWY04L LEMPU1M/1N RWY04L/R BISBO1M/1N RWY22L/R SOTOX1M/1N

DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (DPI) MSG PROVIDED TO NETWORK MANAGER OPERATIONS CENTER (NMOC). 1.1. ADS-B DATA REQUIRED 1.1.1. FOR ADS-B DATA USED BY THE AD OPERATOR AND EUROCONTROL, PILOTS OF AIRCRAFT EQUIPPED WITH MODE S AND ADS-B FUNCTIONALITY MUST, WHEN OPERATING ON THE GROUND: A) SELECT AUTOMATIC MODE AND THE ASSIGNED MODE A, OR B) IF AUTOMATIC MODE IS NOT AVAILABLE, SELECT ON AND THE ASSIGNED MODE A - FROM THE REQUEST OF PUSH-BACK. - AFTER LANDING, UNTIL THE AIRCRAFT HAS STOPPED ON HIS STAND. - WHEN THE AIRCRAFT IS FULLY PARKED, THE PILOT SHALL SELECT STBY. 1.1.2. WHEN THE AIRCRAFT IS CAPABLE OF COMMUNICATING ITS IDENTIFICATION (I.E. THE CALLSIGN USED IN FLIGHT), THIS MUST BE ENTERED (VIA THE FMS OR TRANSPONDER CONTROL PANEL) AT THE TIME OF THE PUSH-BACK REQUEST. 1.1.3. THE CREW MUST USE THE FORMAT DEFINED BY ICAO TO ENTER THE AIRCRAFT IDENTIFICATION. 1.1.4. IN ORDER NOT TO COMPROMISE THE PERFORMANCE OF SYSTEMS BASED ON SSR FREQUENCIES (INCLUDING AIRBORNE TCAS AND SSR RADARS), TCAS SHOULD NOT BE SELECTED BEFORE RECEIVING CLEARANCE TO LINE UP, AND SHOULD BE DESELECTED AFTER VACATING THE RUNWAY.

SX0019/24 AIP SUPPLEMENT LFSB/BASLE/MULHOUSE VALIDITY: 03APR24 0300 - 15JUN24 0300 UTC -DESCRIPTION : THIS AIP SUP DESCRIBES THE PROGRESS OF WORK TO REPAIR PART OF TAXIWAY BRAVO, BETWEEN TAXIWAYS ECHO AND FOX. THE OPERATIONS WILL TAKE PLACE IN ONE WORK PHASE, ACTIVATED BY NOTAM. -GENERAL DISPOSITIONS : WORK CARRIED OUT AT NIGHT AND/OR DURING THE DAY. -AWO : FLIGHT PROCEDURES IN BAD WEATHER CONDITIONS (LVP) WILL NOT BE AFFECTED, BUT GROUND TAXIING WILL BE ADAPTED (STOP BARS OUT OF SERVICE). ACFT TAXIING WILL BE PARTIALLY REROUTED VIA TAXIWAY ALPHA AND THE MAIN RWY, DEPENDING ON THEIR WINGSPAN. ALL ARRIVING ACFT WILL BE PLACED BY A MARSHALL (FOLLOW-ME). - RESTRICTIONS / REGULATIONS : TRAFFIC REGULATIONS MEASURES WILL BE SET UP AND WAITING TIMES ARE TO BE EXPECTED ON ARRIVAL AND ON DEPARTURE. A35K, A388, CSM AND A346 ACFT WILL NOT BE ACCEPTED ON THE PLATFORM DURING THE CONSTRUCTION PERIOD (DUE TO GROUND TRAFFIC RESTRICTIONS). EXCEPT FOR MOVEMENTS ON THE MAIN RWY, FOUR-ENGINED ACFT WILL HAVE TO TAXI ON THE PLATFORM WITH THE OUTER ENGINES SHUT DOWN. SECONDARY RWY 07/25 WILL BE CLOSED WHEN QFU 33 IS IN USE. THE NORTH APRON WILL BE RESERVED FOR ACFT WITH WINGSPANS 44 M. CREWS OF ACFT WITH WINGSPANS 44 M MUST TAXI WITH CARE ON TAXIWAYS FOX AND GOLF AND MUST USE THE OVERSTEERING TECHNIQUE. CREWS OF ACFT WITH WINGSPANS BETWEEN 24 M AND 36 M MUST TAXI WITH CARE ON TAXIWAYS M1 AND M2 AND MUST USE THE OVERSTEERING TECHNIQUE. TAXIWAY ECHO WILL BE RESERVED FOR ACFT WITH WINGSPANS 36 M. TAXIWAY BRAVO BETWEEN 1 AND ECHO WILL BE RESERVED FOR ACFT WITH WINGSPANS 36 M. THE WORKSITE WILL BE SET UP DURING THE NIGHT BETWEEN APRIL 2 AND APRIL 3 2024.

ADS-B DATA FOR ECRA (EUROPEAN CONNECTED REGIONAL AIRPORTS PROGRAMME) OPERATIONS. 1.1.IN ORDER TO COOPERATE WITH ADS-B RECEIVER USED BY AIRPORT OPERATOR AND EUROCONTROL FOR USE OF THE ECRA PROGRAMME AT EINDHOVEN AIRPORT,PILOTS OF MODE S EQUIPPED ACFT WITH ADS-B FUNCTIONALITIES WHEN OPERATING ON THE GROUND SHALL: A)SELECT AUTO MODE AND THE ASSIGNED MODE A CODE OR B)IF AUTOMODE IS NOT AVAILABLE, SELECT ON (E.G.XPDR) AND THE ASSIGNED MODE A CODE. -FROM THE REQUEST FOR TOWER PUSH-BACK OR TAXI,WHICHEVER IS EARLIER -AFTER LANDING,CONTINUOUSLY UNTIL THE ACFT IS FULLY PARKED IN ITS STAND. -WHEN THE ACFT IS FULLY PARKED, FLT CREW SHALL SELECT STBY. 1.1.2.WHENEVER THE ACFT IS CAPABLE OF REPORTING ACFT IDENTIFICATION (I.E.CALLSIGN USED IN FLT), THIS SHOULD BE ENTERED (THROUGH THE FMS OR THE TRANSPONDER CONTROL PANEL) AT THE TIME OF THE REQUEST FOR TOWED PUSH-BACK OR TAXI, WHICHEVER IS EARLIER. 1.1.3.AIR CREW MUST USE THE ICAO DEFINED FORMAT TO ENTER THE ACFT IDENTIFICATION. 1.1.4.TO ENSURE THAT THE PERFORMANCE OF SYSTEMS BASED ON SSR FREQ (INCLUDING AIRBORNE TCAS AND SSR RADARS) IS NOT COMPROMISED, TCAS SHOULD NOT BE SELECTED BEFORE RECEIVING CLEARANCE TO LINE UP, AND SHOULD BE DESELECTED AFTER VACATING THE RWY.

Paragraph.Text: SX0060/22 AIP SUPPLEMENT EBBU/FIR - RESTRICTIONS RELATED TO THE RUSSIAN INVASION OF UKRAINE - 08SEP22-UFN 1 AVOIDANCE OF OPERATIONS IN THE CRISIS AREA BELGIAN AIR OPERATORS AND OWNERS OF AIRCRAFT REGISTERED IN BELGIUM SHALL NOT ENTER UKBU, UKLV, UKBV, UKDV, UKFV, UKOV, URRV. FLIGHT OPERATIONS SHALL ALSO BE AVOIDED WITHIN THE BUFFER ZONE EXTENDING OUT TO 200 NM ALONG THE UKRAINE/RUSSIA BORDER. OPERATIONS WITHIN LUUU SHALL ONLY BE UNDERTAKEN IN COMPLIANCE WITH THE APPLICABLE AERONAUTICAL PUBLICATIONS ISSUED BY THE REPUBLIC OF MOLDOVA. ADDITIONAL RISK ASSESSMENT AND FLIGHT PLANNING DECISIONS SHALL BE TAKEN BEFORE OPERATING UUWV. 2 RESTRICTIONS FOR RUSSIAN OPERATORS LL RUSSIAN REGISTERED AIRCRAFT AND AIRCRAFT OWNED, CHARTERED OR OPERATED, OR OTHERWISE CONTROLLED BY NATURAL OR LEGAL PERSONS FROM THE RUSSIAN FEDERATION OR BY OPERATORS HOLDING AN AIR OPERATOR CERTIFICATE (AOC) ISSUED BY THE RUSSIAN FEDERATION AUTHORITIES ARE PROHIBITED TO ENTER, EXIT OR OVERFLY BELGIAN AND LUXEMBOURGISH AIRSPACE, EXCEPT FOR HUMANITARIAN, SAR AND LEASED AIRCRAFT ONE-WAY RETURN FLIGHTS WITH THE PERMISSION OF THE APPROPRIATE BELGIAN OR LUXEMBOURGISH AUTHORITIES AND IN CASE OF EMERGENCY LANDING OR EMERGENCY OVERFLIGHT.
